verses.text: And it came to pass on the eighth day, \add that\add* Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;
and he said unto Aaron, Take thee a young calf for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and offer \add them\add* before the \sc Lord\sc*.
And unto the children of Israel thou shalt speak, saying, Take ye a kid of the goats for a sin offering; and a calf and a lamb, both of the first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering;
also a bullock and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before the \sc Lord\sc*; and a meat offering mingled with oil: for to day the \sc Lord\sc* will appear unto you.
And they brought \add that\add* which Moses commanded before the tabernacle of the congregation: and all the congregation drew near and stood before the \sc Lord\sc*.
And Moses said, This \add is\add* the thing which the \sc Lord\sc* commanded \add that\add* ye should do: and the glory of the \sc Lord\sc* shall appear unto you.

And Moses said unto Aaron, Go unto the altar, and offer thy sin offering, and thy burnt offering, and make an atonement for thyself, and for the people: and offer the offering of the people, and make an atonement for them; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded.
Aaron therefore went unto the altar, and slew the calf of the sin offering, which \add was\add* for himself.
And the sons of Aaron brought the blood unto him: and he dipt his finger in the blood, and put \add it\add* upon the horns of the altar, and poured out the blood at the bottom of the altar:
but the fat, and the kidneys, and the caul above the liver of the sin offering, he burnt upon the altar; as the \sc Lord\sc* commanded Moses.
And the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.
And he slew the burnt offering; and Aaron’s sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled round about upon the altar.
And they presented the burnt offering unto him, with the pieces thereof, and the head: and he burnt \add them\add* upon the altar.
And he did wash the inwards and the legs, and burnt \add them\add* upon the burnt offering on the altar.
And he brought the people’s offering, and took the goat, which \add was\add* the sin offering for the people, and slew it, and offered it for sin, as the first.
And he brought the burnt offering, and offered it according to the manner.
And he brought the meat offering, and took a handful thereof, and burnt \add it\add* upon the altar, beside the burnt sacrifice of the morning.

He slew also the bullock and the ram \add for\add* a sacrifice of peace offerings, which \add was\add* for the people: and Aaron’s sons presented unto him the blood, which he sprinkled upon the altar round about,
and the fat of the bullock and of the ram, the rump, and that which covereth \add the inwards\add*, and the kidneys, and the caul \add above\add* the liver:
and they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burnt the fat upon the altar:
and the breasts and the right shoulder Aaron waved \add for\add* a wave offering before the \sc Lord\sc*; as Moses commanded.
And Aaron lift up his hand towards the people, and blessed them, and came down from offering of the sin offering, and the burnt offering, and peace offerings.
And Moses and Aaron went into the tabernacle of the congregation, and came out, and blessed the people: and the glory of the \sc Lord\sc* appeared unto all the people.
And there came a fire out from before the \sc Lord\sc*, and consumed upon the altar the burnt offering and the fat: \add which\add* when all the people saw, they shouted, and fell on their faces.
